page.title: 10ARLINGTON MILL,BIBURY
page.content: In the 17th century the mill was a cloth mill and up to 1914 the local farmers woulld still bring their corn to be ground into flour. Later it was restored and made into a folk museum and art gallery. There are many old clothes, house_hold goods and farm machinery, stuffed wild life, old dolls, toys and paintings. In 1985 new curators are extending the scope of the museum with week-end demonstrations of country crafts like spinning, potterey and making corn dollies. During the summer evenings there are lectures on country and local topics with the occasional poetry reading. The museum is open to visitors every day during the summer and at week-ends in the winter.
